summary: This is an email chain between US Attorney's Office personnel regarding travel approval and hotel arrangements for a trip to Los Angeles from February 25-29, 2020, to conduct interviews related to the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618). The emails discuss switching hotels due to price and construction issues, and mention meetings with attorneys for individuals named Bjorlin and Malyshev.

persons.name: Paul Byrne
persons.context: Sends an email acknowledging receipt of travel information and stating they will review it on their side.

persons.name: Amanda N. Young
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) on the initial email from Paul Byrne.

persons.name: Darlene A. Alleyne
persons.context: Addressed in an email regarding hotel reservations for the Los Angeles trip; appears to be involved in travel approval or logistics.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: Approves the travel request for the Los Angeles trip related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Submits the initial travel approval request for the team to conduct interviews in Los Angeles for the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Kamilla
persons.context: Mentioned as someone for whom a conference room at the Beverly Hilton hotel could be obtained during the Los Angeles trip.

connections.description: Alex requests travel approval from Edward Tyrrell for the Epstein investigation team trip.
Edward Tyrrell copies Darlene Alleyne on the travel approval communication.
Alex follows up with Darlene Alleyne regarding hotel reservations made for the approved trip.

events.title: Scheduled Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The US Attorney's Office team has at least one interview scheduled in Los Angeles; they also plan to get a conference room for this date.

events.title: Epstein Investigation Team Travel to Los Angeles
events.description: The US Attorney's Office team receives approval to travel to Los Angeles to conduct interviews related to the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The US Attorney's Office was actively conducting interviews in Los Angeles in February 2020 as part of the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618).
The travel was approved by Edward Tyrrell of the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS).
The team planned to meet with attorneys for individuals named Bjorlin and Malyshev, indicating these were persons of interest or witnesses in the investigation.
Logistical details, such as avoiding a hotel under construction and staying within government per diem rates, were carefully considered for the trip.
The email chain demonstrates ongoing investigative work related to Epstein well after his death in August 2019.
